reviews.text: I might as well get this out of the way first: charging 3,000 CLP ($6.38 USD at the current exchange rate) is way too much to ask dorm sleepers to pay for a towel. Even if the towels, as they are at this hostel, are fresh white ones without stains, and a hand towel is included along with the bath towel.
reviews.title: Beautiful hostel, friendly staff; insane price for towels

reviews.text: The price of non-included towels aside, this hostel is really lovely and feels much more like a bed and breakfast than a hostel. Indeed, it would probably be best classified as a bed and breakfast. The building is incredibly charming; great wood finishes throughout.
reviews.title: This is gorgeous

reviews.text: Some other advantages are: strong WIFI throughout the building, gorgeous common areas (including a gourmet kitchen), free purified water, eggs available for cooking at breakfast, and really friendly staff.
reviews.title: Great place!

reviews.text: I would certainly stay here again without question, but would seriously encourage the owner to consider dumping the towel charge. This is a high-quality establishment with a price to match -- make the towels part of the deal.
reviews.title: Friendliest hostel I've ever been in

reviews.text: What an incredible place! The hostal has a european charm with art wood, and everywhere a nice touch. There is a nice patio, the rooms are clean and have huge windows, often looking towards a small garden and I loved the bathroom (towels included). Thanks for the good breakfast btw. Wifi is great, prices reasonable (12000 for dorm with 5, but you get a luxury version of many others here). Definitly a nice place to explore Santiago, btw also in a good neighbourhood and close to metro. My new address for Santiago, for sure.
reviews.title: Beautiful hostel with perfect atmosphere
